t: My*p breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves are ready for me.
Are*p there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?
Lay*p down now, put me in a surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?
For*p thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt them.
He*p that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.
He*p hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a tabret.
Mine*p eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.
Upright*p men shall be astonished at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.
The*p righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.
But*p as for you all, do ye return, and come now: for I cannot find one wise man among you.
My*p days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.
They*p change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.
If*p I wait, the grave is mine house: I have made my bed in the darkness.
I*p have said to corruption, Thou art my father: to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister.
And*p where is now my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?
They*p shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.
